intro: Elytranthe brandisiana, commonly known as the rock wallflower, is a small, flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, with hairy leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
